a.title: Slice strength: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.

title.value: Cross-version Extension `R5.Medication.ingredient` for use in FHIR R4

description.value: This cross-version extension represents the FHIR R5 element `Medication.ingredient` for use in FHIR R4.

purpose.value:
This extension is part of the cross-version definitions generated to enable use of the element `Medication.ingredient` as defined in FHIR R5 in FHIR R4.
The source element is defined as: `Medication.ingredient` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Across FHIR versions, the element set has been mapped as: * R5: `Medication.ingredient` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4B: `Medication.ingredient` 0..* `BackboneElement` * R4: `Medication.ingredient` 0..* `BackboneElement`
Following are the generation technical comments: Element `Medication.ingredient` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: Identifies a particular constituent of interest in the product.

comment.value: The ingredients need not be a complete list. If an ingredient is not specified, this does not indicate whether an ingredient is present or absent. If an ingredient is specified it does not mean that all ingredients are specified. It is possible to specify both inactive and active ingredients.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

definition.value: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

description.value: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

definition.value: An Extension

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

short.value: The ingredient (substance or medication) that the ingredient.strength relates to

definition.value: The ingredient (substance or medication) that the ingredient.strength relates to. This is represented as a concept from a code system or described in another resource (Substance or Medication).

requirements.value: The ingredient may reference a substance (for example, amoxicillin) or another medication (for example in the case of a compounded product, Glaxal Base). Element `Medication.ingredient.item` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`. Element `Medication.ingredient.item` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.item[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

requirements.value: True indicates that the ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug (i.e. active). False indicates that the ingredient does not affect the therapeutic action of the drug (i.e. inactive). Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.isActive`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

human.value: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

definition.value: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.

requirements.value: Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.strength`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: The ingredient (substance or medication) that the ingredient.strength relates to. This is represented as a concept from a code system or described in another resource (Substance or Medication).

requirements.value: The ingredient may reference a substance (for example, amoxicillin) or another medication (for example in the case of a compounded product, Glaxal Base). Element `Medication.ingredient.item` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`. Element `Medication.ingredient.item` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.item[x]`, but has no comparisons. Note that the target element context `Medication.ingredient.item[x]` is a choice-type element and cannot directly hold extensions. The context is moved up to parent element `Medication.ingredient`.

definition.value: Slice to indicate the presence of a R5 `CodeableReference` in FHIR R4
A reference to a concept - e.g. the information is identified by its general class to the degree of precision found in the terminology.

A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.

requirements.value: Element `CodeableReference.reference` has a context of CodeableConcept based on following the parent source element upwards and mapping to `CodeableConcept`. Element `CodeableReference.reference` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Reference`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: A reference to a resource the provides exact details about the information being referenced.
Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

requirements.value: True indicates that the ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug (i.e. active). False indicates that the ingredient does not affect the therapeutic action of the drug (i.e. inactive). Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.isActive` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.isActive`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: Indication of whether this ingredient affects the therapeutic action of the drug.

Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.

requirements.value: Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` is part of an existing definition because parent element `Medication.ingredient` requires a cross-version extension. Element `Medication.ingredient.strength[x]` has is mapped to FHIR R4 element `Medication.ingredient.strength`, but has no comparisons.

definition.value: Specifies how many (or how much) of the items there are in this Medication. For example, 250 mg per tablet. This is expressed as a ratio where the numerator is 250mg and the denominator is 1 tablet but can also be expressed a quantity when the denominator is assumed to be 1 tablet.
